text: 375ml bottle. Hazy orange shade. Short white head. Wild and barnyard-y aroma. Good balance to the taste. Acidity is not too much. Fruit character is either subtle or has fallen off a bit. Still enjoyable.

Bottle. Pours hazy deep orange with a medium, rather creamy white head that soon disappears. Aroma is tart, fruity, earthy undertone, oranges, zesty apple, light plum. Medium, prickly carbonation, wonderful creamy and kinda fat, sticky mouthfeel. Flavour has initial heavy sourness, tart red apple, plums, then turn funky, soft citric. No real lactic tartness. Lingering, fresh and drinkable flavour. Wonderful Lambic.
Odeur de lambic. Trouble et très peu de mousse. Acidité bien présente mais qui attaque moins quune geuze classique. Prune difficile à décerné. On goute ben le fut. Geuze très sympa.
Old lambic Aroma. Sweet and sour taste. In the middle it feels like not yet ripe berries.

Toer de Gueze 2017. Bottle at Gueuzerie Tilquin. Muddy brownish-orange with white head. The aroma has notes of plum, very fruity, juice, wood, yeasts and dried fruits. Sourish and bitterish flavor with notes of citrus (lemon), plum, wood, some spiciness, a bit hot. Flat, light to medium-bodied.

Bottle at Gueuzerie Tilquin during Toer de Gueze 2017. Hazy orange with a creamy white head. Aroma is funky and fruity, notes of oak and red fruits. Sour, tropical fruits, lemon, wood, berries, prunes, apricots. Medium-bodied, smooth. Great.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2017 From Toer de Geuze 2017 >> Et par rapport à la Quetch ? Un fruité plus robuste surtout sur la rondeur du fruit apporte à cette bière beaucoup de saveurs grâce au fruité très charnu qui rend la dégustation plus que délicieuse. Ici encore, lacidité arrive en Guest Star sur des notes de barriques plus ou moins complexes avec pour différence, sur celle-ci, de prolonger les saveurs fruités avec beaucoup de longueur au palais.
Bottle - Funky sweetness and a touch of sour plum. Cloudy gold with no head. Tart and funky with some soured plum notes. Nice and dry.

Bitter, dry, sour fruits, citrus fruits, prunes, plums, dusty straw. Clear gold, small, creamy, white head. Medium sour. More dry fruits, citrus fruits, bitter prunes, sour plums, soft carbonation, medium bodied. Very nice Lambic, well-balanced, many subtle flavours. Bottle shared at CBC Islington tasting - thanks to madmitch76!

Bottle shared at craft beer Co Islington. Many thanks to Kenny for this one. A translucent golden orange coloured pour with a halo of white head. Aroma is rubber ball, grassy, funky horsey, grassy citrus, rubber funk. Flavour is composed of sour bitter lacto, horsey funk, little bile, apricot, underripe berries. Palate is seet and sour, bitter lemon, highish carbonation. Really good.

Pours an amber body with a medium head. Fruity aroma with a funky touch. Taste is fruity, dry and with a well balanced sourness.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Rami Rami is drinking an Oude Quetsche Tilquin à LAncienne Avec Prunes De Namur (2015-2016) by Gueuzerie Tilquin at Saska Kępa

Ooo, fajowo, aromat zwyklego ale klasa gueuze, w smaku sliwki wychodza, choc pewnie bym strzelal w jasne jakies, agrest, skora, fajna paleta
W zapachu jest słodko. W smaku bardzo ciekawy posmak śliwkowy. Zdecydowanie warte spróbowania.
Excellent as usual from Tilquin. Lovely tart sourness to complement the prunes that add nice sweetness.
Zeer zuur in de smaak die zeer snel verdwijnt in de afdronk. Komt hierdoor wat ééndimensioneel over. Niettemin zeer funky en genietbaar.
hay and plums in aroma. Tastes sour with a plum notes. Interesting beer (not my type) but worth a try. Texture is bad but beer is overall good.
Dużo świeżych śliwek, owocowe, świeże. Skórka ze śliwek, słodkie nuty śliwkowego miąższu. Wyraźna kwasowość w posmaku. Pije się przyjemnie.

Bottle... Pours hazy and golden with a fleeting, white head. The aroma is simply grains and wood. Full-bodied with soft carbonation. The flavor features sour stone fruits - mainly plums. Tart, yeasty finish. Bottle courtesy of landhoney!
Bottled. A hazy golden beer with a beige head. The aroma has notes of wood, barnyard, malt, and straw. The flavor is acidic with notes of barnyard, malt, and straw, leading to a tart finish.
Backlog, ocena przepisana z untappd, w ramach uzupełniania profilu na ratebeer. Wow. Kwaśne, dzikie, owocowe, klasa 3Fonteinen.

(Bouteille provenant de El Cerrito Market): Le noyau de prune, ayant arraché quelques lambeaux de chair au passage, mène une meute céréalière et bactérienne au relief savamment imbriqué. La texture est sublime, à cheval entre aérien et moelleux avec une acidité modérée. Le fruit est suffisamment présent, comme le niveau de rusticité et de barrique. Moins sec et tranchant que la version régulière mais aussi grandiose.

Refrigerated 375 cl been bottle corked and capped poured into a glass. Orange with big light orange highlights and small white head. Aroma is nice citrus, medium body, lower carbonation, and little lacing. Taste is slightly tart peach, some funk, and some plums.
Bottle at tuulensuu, tampere. Hazy dark golden color, no head. Aroma has sour peach notes, fruits, earthy notes, hint of plums. Sour taste, peaches, some sweet plum notes, stables.

Bottle. Unclear darker orange in color with a whitish head. Funky barnyard, wooden earthy notes, sour fruits and plums in aroma. Tart and nice. Sour notes in 

taste, some plums and bit of funkyness here and there as well. Wooden earthy cellar. Dry. Fruity tart and wooden finish.

Tasting with Alex and George. Pours a hazy golden prune-ish with a white head. Aroma is earthy, slightly fruity, funky. Taste is the same with some ascorbic notes as well as in Gueuze. There is no big difference between this version and regular one, except more acidity. Good one.

Aroma of tart apples, gooseberry, fresh plums, later a bit of vinegar
Beautiful colour, like rose wine
High sourness
A bit too much vinegar
375ml bottle of 2015/2016. Pours a hazy brown color with a bit of head. Nice balance of sour, bitumen and fruit.

2014/15 edition. Consumed in an angry rage after another disgraceful AaB loss while listening to Slayer. Hazy golden, medium sized white head. Crisp, must, cheese, apple, wood, fatness, lemon. Intense. Full body, filling mouthfeel, some sweetness, long lasting sourness. Lemony finish. Intense. Cheesy lactic finish. Perhaps a year or two in a cellar would do it good, it feels a bit aggressive.
375ml bottle pours out a hazy golden topped with a white head. Nose is lots of funky barnyard prune fruit sweetness. Taste is more of the funky barnyard bugs and a prune fruit sweetness.
Shared bottle. Pours reddish orange with a small white head. Aroma of fruit and funk. Taste is plums, fruit, funk, and some wood. Excellent.

Shared 37.5cl bottle. Pours an orangish-bronze, with a minimal off-white head. Aroma of sour fruit. Taste is sour plum, vinous, funky. Very tart finish, but nicely balanced by some sweetness. Excellent.

Hazy peach color with a pinkish hue, off-white head. Aroma is quite funky with nice barnyard notes but also fresh fruit. Taste is tart but not puckering, fruity yet balanced, slightly bitter on the finish with fruit skin flavor. Medium body and carbonation, really easy to drink. A really good fruit lambic, not as acidic or harsh as others.
Bottle sample at SBWF. Pours hazy orange with a small white head. Aroma of plums. Taste is a bit sour but with a fruity feel.

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Brown, orange, hazy. Small white head.
Aroma of plums and raisins, cellar.
Taste sour, nice, plum, dried fruit. So nice!

Ive had this a few times. Didnt realize I hadnt written a review. Splitting a 375mL bottle with Brad.

Golden orange body with a small, off-whit collar. Aromas of authentic Belgian lambic and all the wonderfulness that brings. Plum, raisins, grapes. Musty, funky, earthy, with some cellar / basement scents and flavors. Medium-high acidity. Good stuff.
Keg at SBWF.  Cloudy amber, minimal head. Citric prune aroma. Dry and peppery with medium body and rounded mouthfeel. Prunes and lemon. Fairly low bitterness. Not up to high expectations.
Sample @ SBWF. A really nice and drinkable fruit lambic with notes rhubarb, horse blanket and elderflower. Balanced fruitiness. A bit dry.
Pours a pinkish orange with a thin white head. Aroma of funk, oak and earth. Taste is sour, plums, oak and funk. This blend is delicious
75 cl bottle. Pours hazy orange with a small head. Aroma is dry barnyard, fruity and wooden. Lingering fruity. Medium dry, smooth prunes fruity. Lingering fruity finish.
2014 Bottle - thx Sune. Hazy amber with an off white head. Barnyard , apple and plum aroma. Sweet fruity flavour with a fair amount of tartness.

Bottle thanks to Sune and Mads, shared at Himmeriget, Copenhagen - orange pour with white head. Sour fruity aroma and taste, some plum and apricot fruity notes, nice palate and mouth feel, some funky farmyard notes into the close.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

2014 Bottle from Brussels at Himmeriget. Pours a hazy orange with a small off-white head. Quite tart with fruity aromas of abricot and plum. Also aromas of cask wood and berries. Medium bodied. Soft carbonation. Long tart and bitter finish.

Bottle sample at SBWF.
Pours cloudy.
Sour rather anonymous fruity roundness, but mainly gueze taste.

375 mL bottle shared by ebone1988 because house. 2015-2016 vintage. The pour is a darker orange gold color with a thick white head that falls to a thin film leaving a couple spots of lace. The aroma is sour, funky, and acidic. There is a nice fruitiness to it, and a good lemon sourness. The flavor is a little more balanced. There is a strong acidity up front that moves through a nice sweet juicy prune. The normal sourness really comes through as it sits on the tongue. The mouth feel is a little heavy, but its nicely balanced between sour, funk, and fruit. The aftertaste is a hint acidic and nicely sweet with fruit. Its an interesting balance but well executed.

Bottle shared with koleminer20 and Gus, because I bought a house. 2015-2016 vintage. Aroma is funky, tart, plums, prunes, skins, barnyard, yowza. Appearance is amber golden, hazy, white head. Taste is nice, funky, sour, prunes and plums, barnyard, dry, good. Mouthfeel is light to medium body, light crisp carbonation, prunes and tart aftertaste. Overall, Im a fan.

37.5cl 2015-2016 bottle. Hazy orange color with a very small off-white head. Apricot, plums, peach, sour, barnyard, wood and funk in the aroma. Average carbonation and medium body. Taste is sour and sweet with citric and fruity notes. Overall, a very good beer.

UPDATED: SEP 16, 2016 375ml bottle at home, 2015-2016 (2016.01.11). Pours a cloudy pink grapefruit like colour. Nose of sour, funk, and plums. Flavour of the same, nice sourness, plums, and some funk. Yum and yum.

375ml bottle at home, 2014-2015 (2015.01.27). Pours a slight hazy orange. Nose of sour, funk, and plums. Flavour... oh wow, puckering sour. Very much like unripened plums I used to pick as kid from the neighbours tree.

Aroma: fruity and sour; Appearance: hazy brown-orange pour with thin white head that dissipates quickly; Taste: quite tart and fruity; refreshing; Palate: light-medium body with long, tart finish that turns sweeter towards the end; Overall: very pleasant, especially when drinking in a castle on the Rhein.

Bottle sample at a tasting at Tom Ls place. Thanks Vova. 2014-2015 bottle. Hazy orange. Lovely aroma with barnyard, oak, fruitiness. Sour flavor, puckering, funky, fruity, juicy, lemony. Medium-bodied. Wonderful,

Bottle 375ml. corked. [ As Oude Quetsche Tilquin à lAncienne avec Prunes de Namur ].Clear medium red - yellow orange color with a small to average, frothy - fizzy, fair lacing, mostly diminishing, off-white head. Aroma is moderate to light heavy barnyard, leather, manure, fruity, plum. Flavor is moderate to heavy sweet and acidic with a long duration, tart - citric, dry dry, tart apple, tart plum, manure, funky, sweet fruit - plum. Body is medium, texture is oily to watery, carbonation is soft to flat. [20150924]

My Bottom Line:
This bubbly lambic develops oranges and plums in a starkly funky and acidic setting.

Further Personal Perceptions:
-A veil of foam covers the hazy orange.
-Funk levels are pretty high, which decreases drinkability for me.
-High effervescence works well with the fruitiness.
-Wet haystacks are apparent throughout.
-This isnt as refined as their Gueuze.
-Like this one a tad more than their regular Quetsche, but still not worth the extra expense compared their Gueuze, imho.

Bottle.

375 ml bottle @ Gastropub Tuulensuu. BBE 11.01.2026.
Pours hazy orange color with a small head. Aroma is mild apricot and herbs, yeast and some mild wooden notes. Flavor is apricot and grapefruits, some gooseberries, decently sour palate. Nice and pleasant. 
3355
Bottle 375ml @ Tuulensuu. Pours hazy orange with a white head. Sour, plums, barnyard, fruits aroma. Sour, citrus, unripe plums, wood flavour.
Bottle @ Akkurat. Hazy orange with an off-white head. Aroma is sweet, malty, barnyard and plums. Flavor is medium sweet and rather acidic. Dry and rather acidic finish. 250716

Bottle @ home. Opaque orange color, medium sized white head that lasts for a short while. Aroma is sourish, peach, apricot. Taste is quite sour, but fruity sour, not acidic. A mix of flavors follow: unripe peach, ripe peach, apricot, prunes, unripe plums, fruitpeel sour-bitter and pretty dry finish. Lingering fruity sourness after each sip. You have to able to withstand the sourness level, I know for a fact when I started on ratebeer I would have thrown this away, but if you can youll find a fine blend of fruity flavors. Lovely.

UPDATED: JUL 23, 2016 37,5cl bottle at home, 2015-2016 ed. Cloudy amber, golden colour, beige foamy head that leaves a nice lacing. Nicely sour and tard, light funk, really nice and fruity plum notes specially in the nose, woody. Lively carbonation, good body.

375ml bottle from 2014. Opaque dehydrated pee colour with an off white head that disappears almost instantly. Hugely mouth puckering palate but more balanced aroma; tart with sour, hay, unripe plum skin, lemon pulp, dried apricot pit, very dry, complex finish, enamel pealing towards the end, lots of epson salts up front with a moderate+ carbonation and a full body.

Millième évaluation. Bouteille datée du 27/01/2015, bue après 17 mois. Robe dorée tirant vers lorangée un peu trouble sans col de mousse excepté un petit voile. Arômes de citron, jeunes prunes sucrées, foin, levures sauvages. Notes boisées et autres petits fruits sûrets genre canneberges ou groseilles. En bouche, acidité citrique, chair de jeunes prunes apportant un petit côté sucré, léger bois, petits fruits acides. Les saveurs sucrées sont très bien intégrées sans pour autant enlever la personnalité de la gueuze. Texture légèrement huileuse, fine et faible carbonatation, corps mince. Très bonne gueuze aux fruits.

375 ml bottle bought @ De Hopduvel if I remember correctly. 2015/2016 label. Pours very hazy burnt golden with a fizzy offwhite head that leaves some sparse sticky lacing on the glass while dissipating. Smell is fruity and funky with sourdough crackers, lemon juice, lime juice, ripe green plums, leather, barnyard, minerals, lemon zest and hints of rubber. Taste is sour, fruity and funky. Mouthfeel is dry, tart, sparkling and light bodied. Finish is sour, fruity and funky with citric lambic and tons of ripe plums. Very rich on the fruit at this age. Lovely!

Bottle at De Prael shared by Pierre Tilquin during his Carnivale lecture. Murky orange with short lasting white head. Apricot, sour plums, white grapes, soft funk, light milky, cobwebs. Under medium sour and very soft bitterness. Medium bodied with surprisingly soft velvety feel and soft carbonation.

Bottle at Nüetnigenough. Pours clear orange with a small, fizzy white head, short retention with light lacing. Aroma is heavy lactic sourness, lemons, light smoky phenols, black walnuts, and prunes with light earthy malt. Flavor is moderate lactic acid, apricot, prunes, lemon, light earthy malt, black walnuts and a dry finish. Light body and medium carbonation.

Butelka. Fajny aromat zagrodowy, rustykalny, skóra, agrest, pestki śliwki. Smak mocno kwaśny i wytrawny, lekko słodko octowy. W smaku spory funk, pestki i skórki słówek, winogron i agrestu, ocet winny, jabłko.
Reddish amber with small white head. Sour fruity aroma. Sour refreshing taste followed by fruity sweetness with plume notes. Some salty touch (like hose). Sourish aftertaste.

750 ml bottle @ Nacht van de Grote Dorst 2016. Cloudy orange body with a small, fast disappearing white head. Aroma is tart, acidic and fruity with distinct Brett and barnyard. Flavor is acidic fruity, berries, not necessary plum, lemon, wood, and funky Brett. Fine balanced body and tart, dry, acidic aftertaste with sour, acidic fruit. Pretty solid and uncompromising Geuze.

Pours a dark, cloudy amber color, with a bubbly, immediately disappearing head.

Smells of a wet hay accompanied tart fruitiness of young plums. A pleasant tartness mingles into a ripe fruit fermented quality, supported by funk driven citrus zest.

Has a lower carbonation, while the beer still turns out to be quite refreshing, as for its high fruit tartness, which almost numbes the tongue.

Tastes of sour citrus peel and dusty malts, revealing a leathery, sweeter note, once mingled together with the plum pulp quality of the beer. Its sourness is there from the beginning, while beautifully complimenting the fruit, showcasing plums which start in a very early, sour stage, slowly evolving riper, juicier and sweeter qualities, which gets added a flowery earthiness during the finish.

Beautifully, well composed beer, with a multi layered plum fruitiness, ending with a unique richness, in which all flavors are allowed to benefit from each other.

Bottle: Pale orange color, white head. Aroma is mainly apple cider, lots of acid, lemon, vinegar. Flavor is also quite soir, lots of lemon juice, salt, cider. Dry finish. Quite intensive acid notes, no plums.

(Oude Quetsche Tilquin à lAncienne avec Prunes de Namur) Bottle 375 ml at home, corked and caged, served into a tumbler. ABV 6.4%
Deep golden orange coloured body, with good activity in it, and a small and thin white head on top, with good retention.
Nice aroma of old wood and cork, green sour grapes.
Great taste, mildly sweet at first with the sourness following straight away, grapes, dried hay, little bit of wheat. 
Medium thin body, nicely carbonated, mildly tart on the palate.
Very good.

(bottle) hazy golden colour with a frothy white head. aroma of cinnamon and clove, with a touch of black pepper, plum dum, bread dough, some green bell peppers and bretty funk. flavour is more bread dough and vanilla, slightly leafy, with a light floral hoppiness, some cranberries and lots of lemon juice in the very tart finish. medium-bodied with lively carbonation.
Bottle. Orange colour with small white head. Fruity, dust, apple aroma. Fruity, tart, acidic, sweet, plums, citric and apple taste. Medium body.

375ml 2014-2016 bottle from trade with SlovakSniper. Thanks man. Aroma: hyper dusty, plum, lemon, over ripped wild apples, woody. App: hazy golden orangeish, minimal to no head. Taste and palate: thin body, soft carbonation, medium dry acidity and a tad salty finish. Overall: aroma is good but taste is a tad better for me, more plums in mouth, more refine... highly drinkable.

Appearance: hazy reddish pale to medium amber with a short loose foamy head diminishing rapidly to nothing, no lacing. (3/5) Aroma: dusty barnyard funk, green apple and plums, woody and vinous notes. (9/10) Taste: mild to moderate sweet, strong tart, mild funk. (8/10) Palate: light body, prickly to moderate carbonation, very dry tart funky finish. (4/5)

Had I not done them in quick succession, Im not sure I could have identified any significant variations between this version and the one made with Quetsche véritable dAlsace. Having done so, though, it seems to me that this version is just slightly less bright and tart than the other. Dont get me wrong, its still very good, but it suffers, if only slightly, by comparison. (18/20)

01.04.2016, 0,375l bottle @ home:
Nice slightly bubbly-creamy mediumlasting head, hazy. Aroma is sour-ish fruity, mountain cranberries, oak, sour grass, soda powder, minerals, caramel, fruit stones, vinegar, old rope, hints of black currants. Taste is sour-ish dry, soda powder, unripe mountain cranberries, citrus acid, sorrel, oak, sour prunes, old rope, vinegar, berry skin, fruit stones. Medium bitterness, dry acidic mouthfeel. Very nice.
hazy golden liquid with white head. aroma of toffee, apple vinegar, old urine. heavy sour, red currant. light body, light feel, long finish

Bottle at Akkurat. Hazy yellow with slightly fizzy white head. Tart aroma with prunes, lemon, funky barnyard and oak. Taste is quite tart with funky lemon, barnyard, oak and light prunes. Very nicely balanced tartness without falling over to vinegar. Highly refreshing.

Poured a cloudy orange color with aromas of hay, light olums, some funk and a touch of musk. Flavors are the same musky and plums with some sour hay solid light and enjoyable. Very nice could drink a lot of this.
Apple skins, overripe mango, passionfruit, lemon and horse blanket. Taste a bit more sour then the normal quetsche, a bit more fruit presence and a bit more lemony. Solid and preferred.

375 ml bottle as a local trade bonus from Charlie - wow, man, thanks a ton! Pours a cloudy orange with just a bit of a red hue and a small white head that settles into a ring. Sharp woody, sawdusty character throughout, with tart plums, musty funk, grass and faint herbs, yogurt, lemon, grapes, wheat, and a good amount of acidity. Light-medium bodied, with moderate carbonation and an acidic, dry mouthfeel. Very nice.

Bottle at York River Landing, Maine. The base beer has a classic, crisp lambic profile, but the plums are noticeable right away. Some noticeable, puckering dryness from the plum skins and the lambic tartness, which was really good. Definitely worth splashing out for the bottle.

37.5 cl bottle from Etre Gourmet
 pours a hazy orangy yellow with white head that dissipates quickly
 Aroma is sour fruit bit acidic
 Taste is sour fruity dry finish,not overly sour(pity)
 nice beer lots of fruit would like a bit more sourness

Flaska från Etre Gourmet. Fin doft med massor av syrliga dofter. Grape, sura äpplen och lite fuktigt trä. Knivskarp syra, torr och stram men inte så mycket frukt eller funk. Lite svår med sin vassa syra men annars riktigt gott.

Bottle. Nose of plums, leathwr, dust, dry horse blamket, grapefruit. Brilliant golden orange, clear, lace. Dry, crisp, vy fruity, strong tartness. Grapefruit, spur plum. Nice stuff. Great balance and drinkability.
Bottle. Golden hazy orange pour with white head. Dark fruit, sweetness, light tart and sweet fruit aromas. Tart fruit, plum, dark sweet and tart tones.
Bottle at the Sovereign. Hazy to cloudy deep golden amber color, white head. Aroma has dust, raw dough, light citrus, light fruit. Taste is softly sour plum, fig, mild funk. Tasty and easy drinking.

37cl bottle. Dark orange pour with visible carbonation and a modest white head. Smells sour, of fermented fruit, prunes, apple cider, barnyard funk and grapefruit. Incredibly sour, with notes of prunes, vinegar and white wine. Very refreshing, high carbonation (like a sparkling wine) and a sour acidic aftertaste.
37,5cl bottle. Hazy orange color. Thin white head. Medium body. Dry finish. Taste is medium sour, medium bitter, light sweet. Aroma is citric, fruity, barnyard.

Belle robe dorée, fine mousse. Nez tout en élégance sur des notes de prunes confites, et de prune acidulée sur un fin lambic. Bouche alliant fruit, ampleur, tension, fine bulle, longueur et finale acidulée. Un régal de fin de soirée.

Bottle. Hazy orange kissed yellow, lively white head. Aroma is sour fruits, yoghurt, funk. Lovey Tilquin classic character with a bright plum skin tart/sourness, lightly funky, bright and quenching and crisp. Really terrific!
user_location: the land of bitumen, beef & beer, Alberta, CANADA

text:
Bottle: Served in Cantillon Tumbler:
Small lively off white head. Hazy to light murky yellow orange body.
Beautiful brett, wild, funk, fruit, wood, farm and barn, tart flavour and aroma!
Wonderful! Tilquin did it again, amazing beer!
Good tart, fruity with funk and wood tones... Hmmmm....
Aftertaste is fruit, funk, tart, wood and typical lambic tones.
Low carbo, light creamy tart mouthfeel and a delicoousy balanced more than medium body.
Delicious!
user_location: Best of E-Town mit 2 Brauhausen, NETHERLANDS

text: Bottle at home. Pours Hazy orange with a white. Very tarty, barn, light prunes, very geuze like, fruity notes, rather tarty, dry with a well rounded taste of prunes and lacto.

Bottle from Dranken Geers, Ghent. Pours with a slight haze, orange/chestnut brown, thin white bubbly head which dissipates to nothing quickly. Nose is tart and sour, umeboshi pickled plum, Bramley apple mustiness, plum skins, light plum fruit, moderate funk, lactobacilus sour. Taste is a little young, but the fruit is strong. Only moderately tart and sour, light plum, umeboshi, plum skins, white flesh Bramley apples, funk, light farmyard. Its really really nice. Will be even better with a bit of age.

Bottle @ Home. Thanks for this one, Ronny. Cloudy orange colored beer with some white foam. Really nice fruit and plenty of acidity. Big time citrus zest, lemon, yogurt, and green grape. Slight woodiness, some musty funk, and maybe even a touch of some peach skins. Solid stuff, as usual.
UPDATED: JAN 17, 2016 Bottle. Hazy golden body with a medium white head. Yeast, tartness, prunes, vinegar (in a good way), basement. Tilquin really know how to make great lambic.

Poured into a taster showing dark caramel brown center with thin clear rims and no head. Cloudy and opaque dark center.

The nose shows a lot of brett with some light hints of peach.

The palate is light bodied and gently carbonated. Moderate tartness with flavors of very light prunes. Very oak forward vanilla flavor throughout continuing through the finish and on the linger. A bit too much oak and too little prunes in my opinion.

The color is abricot-colored with a thin foam ring. Lambic typical old feet smell with hints of prune. The taste is delightful sour with a prune and/or apple fruit in the finish. Super dry and sour aftertaste.
Cloudy yellow pour, white head. Nice tilquin funk right up front. Fluffy mouthfeel, yeast, tartness from the plums.
Bottle shared by Bill at Franks. Apparently this is a new tick. Super sour and oaky, cedar, plums and lemons with blanket in the finish. So banging yo.

Murky orange color with small white head. Aroma is typical lambic funk, with subtle prune aromas perfectly embedded, also apples. Taste is again prunes, lacto sourness, some cinnamon. Amazing how the plum aromas are perfectly embedded into the funk. A bit of a dusty finish. Quite sour, but it fits.
Bottle, courtesy of SinH4. Ah, a christmas fruit lambic! Spicy and fruity, beautiful prunes, good funk. I like.
Bottle - pours gold white head - nose and taste of old sour plum, funk, oak, horseblanket and sour lemon - med body
Bottle at tasting. Aroma of tart, red fruit and prunes. Flavor is quite intense, holy crap, this is sour. With horseblanket, funky prunes, old grain and more tart. Puckering punch. Good stuff.

375mL bottled January 27, 2015, drunk 12/10/15.Lightly hazy medium amber body is lightly carbonated, with a rose-flecked head that recedes slowly to a ring.Good amount of plum in the nose is joined by light pepper, sulfur and leathery bacteria and barrel character. Quite soft and mellow already for only 10 months of age. Juicy, with tons of funky barnyard and no sharp, alcoholic or acetic notes to be found.Torched prune is very unique in the flavor. I guess its a combination of the plum notes and intensely phenolic funk character. Its borderline smokey, but the palate adjusts rather quickly and it slowly becomes more of a very dry, sharp balsamic-meets-fig-jam character. Heavy sulfur and biting acidity on the finish. Oh yeah, this is not fucking around. Approaching bone dry, with acidity/tartness sticking to the lips after every sip. Phew, this is intense, powerful stuff. I love it, but objectively, I can see why this turns people off to lambics. Just punishingly sour, as the glass wears on. So take my rating with a grain of salt.

Bouteille meilleure avant le 27/01/2025. Un liquide jaune dorée trouble avec une bon pétillement. Je sens la bière à plus de 40 centimètres de mon nez. Un nez de lambic, des fruits, on sent les fruits. Une bouche tout en équilibre entre le lambic et les fruits, pas trop acide pas sucrée du tout. Superbe texture pour ce genre de bière. Jai des frissons.

375 ml bottle from my EU Local Swap 3/2015 sender Anatole, thanks!
Deep orange, hazy body, with a small, frothy, off-white head.
Aroma of funk, oak, vinegar, various sour, unripe fruits, like citrus, apples, pears.
Taste follows this pretty much.
Medium, slick mouthfeel, with a soft carbonation.
Finishes sour, dry, wooden, with vinegar, some fruits.

Very nice, but too extreme for my linking, very strong sourness. Also didnt get much of the plums. Not so different to the regular version, so not among my favourite style examples.
Bottle. Pale orange cloudy body with white head. Aroma is sour fruits with hints of grains. Taste is very sour with hints of fruits and some wood. Aftertaste is dry and sour.

UPDATED: DEC 19, 2015 0,375l bottle shared by Saeglopur at Linz RB Tasting, big thanks. Vintage 2014/2015. B ottled 01/2015. orange cloudy color, small white head. smells sour, funk, horse blankett, dog poo, some- green apples, spices. uhm, rather interesting smell, not a total fan. medium body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes quite sourish, vinegar, fruits, green apples, marzipan, spices. finishes very dry and sour with green apples and light nuts. OK, did expect a bit more, no fruit notes at all. very very sour, no balance on this one. Overall drinkable but just too sour / vinegarish.

sourness: 5/5
Bottle at Craigs. Pours pale golden, light haze, with a thin white head. Aromas of brett, sour. Taste is dry, sour, mouth-puckeringly so. Heavy vinegar vibe. Dry finish.
Bottle @ Willems , Grobbendonk. Pours hazy deep golden with a white head. Lots of good funk, lemon, barnyard and wood. Lingering dry and tart woody and fruity flavor. Very nice!

Poured from 750 to glass. Hazy orange hue with fizzy white head that dissipated. Aroma is lactic, peppercorn, straw, sweat. Mouthfeel is great with light body and sharp carbonation. Taste is dry with a tart sourness following. Overall this is a fun beer.

How: Bottle.
Where: SBWF 2015.
Appearance: Hazy amber colour with an off-white head.
Aroma: Plums, fruit, lemon, sour, a bit acidic.
Body: Medium body and carbonation.
Flavour: Plums, grapefruit, fruit, funk, lemon, sour.

Bottle thanks to Rainer. Pours a hazy orange with small white head that lasts. The aroma is strong funk, wood, leather, plum skin. Medium mouth, lots of fruit up front, funk in the back. Nice tartness, loved this variant.

Murky golden, no head. Nose is funky mulchy plumminess, dried dark fruit. Initial taste is a daub of sherbert cakey sweet. Carbonation is solid, mouthfeel is itchy lambic. Finishes dry, sweet fruity and sails through the tartness and a gritty dry linger.

Bottle. Hazy glowing golden with white head. Strong funky aroma, the good funk, peppry, citrus, something a little deeper, fruity, manure. Taste is full on lambic funk, earthy, fruity, citrus. Dry and sour as hell. This shits delishis
Bottle at craigs. Pours hazy orange, nose is horseblanket, funky, light fruit, taste is fruity, sour, juicy, dry.

Pours slightly intransparent golden yellow with no head. Aroma is funk and acidic wheaty character and basement aromas. Taste is highly acidic initially, moderate sweetness, moderate fruit sweetness, slight saltiness, lemons.
bottle at home .. hazy amber ... thin white lacing ... soft earthy horseblanket.. musty fruit nose ... tart funk ... big barnyard .. drying funk .. ligth fruits .. light tart ..really barnyardy

Bottle forbids done by, thanks Mikey! Belgium box .. . Pours with a nice sturdy head .. . Prune, watery plum, mild horse, and soggy sour hay .. Mouth is airy, minimal bite .. . Rather mundane, actually not that good when compared to all other Tilquins .. . . Sitting in an alley way right now

Une 37.5 cl partagée avec Ben. BB 27/01/2025. Pas de très grande différence avec la version précédente. Orange est sa robe avec un anneau de mousse. Nez de prunes et de Tilquin à lancienne. Bouche aigre, fruitée, spontanée. Finale de bon lambic de prune ferme et de jeune chair. Délicieux.
UPDATED: NOV 15, 2015 750ml bottle@ Stadin panimobaari. Amber, unclear, thin white head . Tart, sour, vinegary notes. Flavor has vinegar, tartness, green apples and plums in the tart finish.  Acidic.

(Bottle, 0.75 l - BB 09/02/2025, at Stadin Panimobaari, 20151114) The beer poured deep amber and hazy. Its head was small and white. Aroma had tartness, plums, fruitiness and sweetness. Palate was medium bodied and dry with medium carbonation. Flavours were tartness, sourness, plums, grapefruit, sweetness and wood. Aftertaste had tartness, wood and plums. A well done lambic with sweet fruits.
Bottle 0.75l at Stadin Panimobaari, Helsinki. BBE 09/02/2025. Colour is cloudy orange with small white head. Aromas and flavours: Fruits, orange, tropical fruits, sweetness and sourness. Juicy.

Bottle. Pours quite hazy reddish orange, small off-white head, dissipates leaving some lacing. Aroma is quite funky, cheesy, basement funk, horse blanket, some citrus, stonefruits. Flavor is dry, medium tart, medium funk, loads of fruitiness. Medium body, champagnelike carbonation. Pretty damn good.
Bottle. Poured a cloudy golden color with a smaller sized head. Reddish/purplish tint. Dark fruits/prunes, funky, citrus, and some oak.

Small 2014/15 bottle. Rose gold with a small white head thats soon at the rim. Aroma: Wheaty funk, old lemons, quite woody - like the normal version, oddly like pencil shavings with the lead in. More the smell of standing near laden plum trees than of the fruit itself. Alive, slightly kefir-like texture with moderate carbonation. Quite sour and much less fruity than the "normal" Quetsche I had. Long sour finish with apricot kernels.

2014/2015 Vintage
Smell it a mile away - lifted and fresh gueze - fantastic. This is very easy going when compared to the peer group. Some pong and sour fruits, very dry, but otherwise drinking well now.

Bottle thanks to ClarkVV ! Pours a slight pink copper color with a finger of white gaseous foam that fizzles out quickly. Nose is funk, acid and soft fruit mixed with dirty basement and a touch of wet oak. Palate is juicy upfront but dries out quickly. Nice unripe peach fuzz, tannic plum skins, dusty basement, leather, molded lemon peel. Delicious.

Bottle at Indy Man Beer Con 2015. Very tart, chalky candy. Compared to the regular Quetsche, its even more tart, dry and plum flavoured than the original. You can actually taste the fruit stone. Quite earthy. A little funk, blanket dust. Actually think I preferred the bottle of "non-avec" I had but this is still pretty baller.

Pours hazy amber, bit of foam. Aroma is quite astringent, sourness there. Feels totally Belgian. Taste is aggressively sour. Nice dry fruitiness still detectable, works nicely and feels fresh. Aftertaste lingers for a while, drying and nice.

October 16, 2015. Bottle at home, bottled 2015. 
Side by side with regular Quetsche.  
Hazy dark orange with a frothy white head. Aroma is lots of funky barnyard, horse blanket and on top of the fruity plum notes, some lemon, oak, leather and earth. Taste is light sweet with a medium fruity acidity. Finish is light sweet fruity with plum and apples, funky leather and barnyard, sour lemon and dry oak. Medium bodied, dry and average carbonation. 
Compared to the regular it has more of the funky barnyard notes and less of the lemon acidity.

[email protected]/* <![CDATA[ */!function(t,e,r,n,c,a,p){try{t=document.currentScript||function(){for(t=document.getElementsByTagName('script'),e=t.length;e--;)if(t[e].getAttribute('data-cfhash'))return t[e]}();if(t&&(c=t.previousSibling)){p=t.parentNode;if(a=c.getAttribute('data-cfemail')){for(e='',r='0x'+a.substr(0,2)|0,n=2;a.length-n;n+=2)e+='%'+('0'+('0x'+a.substr(n,2)^r).toString(16)).slice(-2);p.replaceChild(document.createTextNode(decodeURIComponent(e)),c)}p.removeChild(t)}}catch(u){}}()/* ]]> */unfortunately got the dregs of the bottle on this one; so not the most attractive but glad to try it. hazy yeasty soupy orange with very tart plum and lactic sourness on nose, full bodied, burning acididty, brett takes a back seat and the plums really add a lot of acidity.

37.5cl bottle. It pours a lightly cloudy apricot-ruby color with a minimal amount of off-white bubbles. Aroma is strongly funky and lemony, with stone fruit, apricots, lemon juice, basement funka and light plums. Taste is again acidic tart tangy lemony, with strong funky basement and stone fruit, light orange, ripe blackberries. Light to medium bodied with sparkling carbonation. Overall, excellent.
Bottle sample at SBWF15. Brownish golden with tiny white head. Aroma of plums, lemon, citric notes and funk. Taste is sour, fresh, funky, lemon, wood, plums with a dry funky finish. Nice!

Tasted on 10/9/15 from a corked and caged 375mL bottle, big thanks to Alex. Pours cloudy bright orange with a thin white head that quickly disappears. The nose is primarily bright lemon acidity, a good amount of funk, light malt, and a bright fruity note. The flavor is very bright, with high acidity, nice funk, and a good amount of bright fruit, that shows a bit more dried and dark on the back of the palate. The body is medium with lively carbonation, nice tannin, and a long tart, but somewhat dried fruity finish.

375 bootle. best by 27/01/2015 so maybe like 9 months old. nobody. 

bright, twangy under-ripened plum and sour grapes. a bit heavy handed on the sour scale. too much lemony sourness detracts from the drinkability, as long sipes could lead to puckering. 

pleasant, fun, enjoyable funk, with notes of soft cowhide leather. rustic musty cheesecloth cellar. 

pretty dry. low carbonation. 

a lot of potential, with some fun leathery funk and nice fruit character. But all of the good things are somewhat dominated by the sharp lemon yogurt sourness. good, but could be more drinkable.

Bottle to tulip
As I try to do with every beer I have at home, I pass it on to my wife for her impressions. She doesnt like beer, but she indulges me. Today her stellar review was that this smells better than it tastes and the taste is a mix between old orange juice (Im guessing spontaneously fermented) and urine.

To me the aroma is plum, gastric acid, apple, and candied sugar. Its a translucent amber with a very creamy 1/2 cm bright white head. Taste is puckering sour, wood, cherry, plum, apple, lemon, and a load of funk. This is fantastic.
A: Light brown colour, no head. Foggy. N: Plum, cheese, lemon, lime, mango. T: Wooden, apple, plum, cheese, lemon O: Tart and very complex beer on both nose and palate. Lovely!

Bottle at Belgoklubben. 

Hazy light orange with a small white head. Aroma of plums, lemon, light bread and funk. Really sour taste of lemon, grain, wood, funk and plums. Refreshing and nicely drinkable. The finish was dry and sour.

Corked bottle from Kraddel, thanks! Pinkish golden color. Dominating oak and plums in the aroma. Sour flavor with oak, plums and dominating grapefruit. Not brilliant, but indeed a very nice fruit lambic.

UPDATED: NOV 27, 2015 Bottle: The aroma consists of light-moderate citrus, lemon, tart plum (more noticeable than in the Quetsche), and light funky oak notes. It pours a cloudy dully orange with a small white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. There is a little bit of dotted lacing left on the sides of the glass. The flavor starts with light-moderate tart citrus and plum. The finish has moderate-heavy puckering sour lemon, citrus, and light woody/oaky flavors. Its light-medium bodied with mild carbonation. Overall, this is delicious and probably my favorite Tilquin.

375 c&c; 2014-2015 from Cave a Bulles. Pours dirty pink/peach with no head. Aroma is median Lambic sour. Near med body. Flavor is tart Lambic sour with some light prune/plum. Pretty good drink. The sour is primary, but the prune persists. Finishes quite tart/sour.

Bottle split at GBBF 15, day 1, big thanks to James for fluking this juan ! 11/08/15.
Hazed golden with light reddish hues topped with a moderate light beige covering. 
Nose is tarte lemon, wood must, pissy, plummy, tarte green berry. 
Taste comprises light acidic strokes, tarte grape, prune jus, tarte plum, wood must, dry rot, apple core.
Medium bodied, fine carbonation, semi drying close with a tarte wooded fruit scrub and puckering effect. 
Xolid gear.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bottle. Hazy amber liquid with small white head. Aroma of lemon, plums, apples, grain, light earth and funk. Taste is dry and medium to high sour with notes of lemon, plums, apples and light grain. Medium bodied with medium carbonation. Really nice!
Bottle. Pours a deep golden reddish color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity sour tart plum aroma. Fruity sour tart woody plum flavor. Has a fruity sour tart woody plum finish.

Bottle shared in Cafe Rose Red. Cloudy dark golden with a pale head. Aroma is plums, funk, apple cider vinegar, white wine. Light-medium bodied, smooth on the palate, lots of fruit up front then a dry, tangy finish with a touch of lingering fruit. Taste is sour plums, fresh plums, purple grapes, dry white wine, fizzy berry candy.

75mL bottle, pours an opaque orange with a small white head. Aroma brings out barnyard funk, fresh juicy plums, and light acidity. Flavour is fruity, with lots of dry plums, some medium funk, and a nice acidic finish. Dryer and fruitier than the regular Quetsche. Excellent.
Bottle. Aroma is good, musty, farmyard. Taste is good, light fruit, easy drinking, light sourness. Tart. Fruit is easy going. I like it.
Bottle @ Dangerous Bottleshares meets Arla Unika. Orangish pour with small lacings. Nose has plums, lemon, lime, funk and some leathery notes. Taste has juicy plums, lemon juice, oak and more plums.

Bottle thanks to Valgreen. Pours orange with a white head. Aroma has vinegar, apples, funk, stable, weak cheese and some notes of plums/prunes if you seek for it. The taste has sour green apples in it along with some more sweet fruit from the prunes. Also some vinegar and funk in there. I really like this!

375ml bottle. Etre Gourmet. Hazy orange. Maybe a hint of pink. Halo of tight, white head. Sour fruit. Soft fruit skin. Stone fruits. Bready, and yeasty. Cider apple. Taste is dry, stone fruit bitter. Lightest of sweetness. Loads of tannin. Palate is smooth, airy, and soft. Finishes dry, tart, and lightly acidic. Very nice. Easy drinking.

Bottle at home, 13th September 15. Pours murky dark golden orange, with bubbles finer than champagne and some neat white lacing. Aroma is sour plum skin, funk, apple core. Taste is tart fruit, plum skin or plum flesh around the stone. Massive flavour, that delights and lingers, the base lambic shines at it warms, with the fruit consistent to the finish

Cloudy light amber color with slight purple tinge. Very big sour nose, with lots plum. Very sour plum with cat piss and lemon. So sour and puckering good. Lingering plum and cobweb finish. Really good my favorite from the brewery.

Bottle thanks to Valgreen. Pours deep hazy orange with a medium white head. Aroma is very funky, citrussy, red sour apples, prunes, moss, dry. Taste is very funky aswell, tart citrus, vinegar, barnyard, prunes, tart red apples. Pretty speciel, pretty nice!

Bottle. Appearance is hazy orange with lively white head. Aroma is lots of barnyard funk, vinious undertones, and ripe fruit. Taste is funky cheese, yogurt, and tart fruit. Love this version, the plums add a nice layer of fruit burst to an already world class lambic.
Bright orange/pink pour. Nose is funky, fruity, acidic. Taste is acidic, stone fruit, very tart. Low carb. Lingering tartness.

Bottle at The Rover, Göteborg. Slightly hazy orange, golden beer with a small offwhite head. Rubber aroma, sour, grapefruit, funky, plums, barnyard notes, citrus, lemon, prunes, tart, slightly acidic, woody, some cranberries. Sour rubber flavor, plums, prunes, woody, barnyard, acidic, really tart, dry, lemon zest, floral notes, dandelions, funky, cranberries, grapefruit notes. Nice body and with a sour floral plum and grapefruit finish. Wonderful beer!

Bottle at Rover cons 2015-09-05 Göteborg
AR: sour plums, barnyard, tart gooseberries 
AP: hazy orange amber, wee ofwhite head
F: elegante sour, barnyard, lemon flesh, Victoria plums, tart, oily, low carbonation, second thought - great with the plums that are present at all times during consumption of this great beer!!!

Bottle thanks to Ole! Pours a reddish orange-golden with a small, white head. Aroma is very funky, dry, moss, tart plums, apples, both green and red. Taste is very juicy, funky dry, sour, tart, a subtle sweetness. High carbonation, juicy body.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2017 August 2015 - Bottle share at GBBF as Tilquin Oude Quetsche à lAncienne avec Prunes de Namur, thanks to James. Hazy orange, still, no real head. Aroma is dirty and sour with apples and brett. Body is medium, tingly carbonation, a little foamy. Taste is peachy, lemon, vinegar, straw with a dry finish, soft acidity. Pretty decent sour. (3.8)
April 2017 - Bottle share at CBC Islington.  Big thanks to Kenny for another try of this.  Aroma is apricot and tangy lambic, lemon and pungent soured fruit sugars.  Taste is cider, figs, tangy fruits.  Great.  Very enjoyable stuff indeed. The higher score Im giving this probably has more to do with my changes in taste rather than any improvement in the beer. (4.1)

Bottle shared at GBBF 2015, day 1 - London. Big thanks to Jim for the scoop! Pours hazy gold with a white cream topping. Lovely nose, lightly jammy, with nips of plum, orange and lemon. Light sweet flavor, bracingly sour, with big acidity, cleansing lemon juice. Light bodied with average, massaging carbonation. Dry finish, lightly musty, with subtle grassy bitterness, acidic lemon. Super clean, refreshing. Very solid overall.

Bottle. Pours darker golden orange clear with small soapy white head. Aroma has slight sulphur, lime, un-ripe prunes, sweet mellow prunes, clean. Some dry brett, oaky. Taste is yammy, sour, lactic sourness, lime and tang. Clean prunes. Mellow and light. Oaky vanilla finish. Tart tangy finish. Really elegant.

Bottle at GBBF 2015. Big thanks to James for randomly finding the only bottle of this! It pours hazy orange-amber with a small white head. The nose is soft, juicy, plum skin, blackcurrant, green apple, mustiness, funk and dirt. The taste is crisp, tart, good mouth-pucker, plum, sour green apple, damp wood, earth, mild acidity and some blackcurrant with a dry finish. Medium body and moderate carbonation. This was like an epiphany after a day of boosting cask ales. Great juicy tartness to it. Delicious!
Bue en bouteille de 75cl. Magnifique nez sur le fruit, pointe dacidité. Au palais, pas mon style mais bien fait.

Poured from a bottle. Hazy golden color, small white head. Strong sour aroma. Medium body with a nice sour flavor and a nice finish. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle from Tanakaya. Pours a clear copper with a small off-white head that dissipates fairly quickly. As soon as I poured it the room filled with plum. Wonderful fully aromatic plum nose, with a nice horse blanket, funky character equally present. Fairly tart and funky with the plum flavors holding up strong but not overtaking the funk. Perfect balance. Slight bit of lemon zest and grass present as well. Lovely tart finish.

375 ml bottle to snifter (shared with the Mrs.). Best before 27/01/2025. Looks solid; a bit undercarbonated though. A hazy lambic orange with fairly thin bubbly white head that dissipates into lacing pretty quickly. Smells good too; funky with a nicely balanced mild plum presence. Tastes like it smells with a soft medium-bodied mouthfeel. Still, enjoyable.

375ml bottle in a stem glass. Pours hazy amber with a purple tint to it and a white head. Aroma of light sourness/funk, some fruits and plums, pale malts, and very faint acetic notes. Flavor the same. Average texture. Still good, but I dont think its the best from this brewery.

(375ml 2015 bottle from Malt Attacks, Brussels, July 28 2015) Pours a hazy dark orange gold with a tiny instantaneous white head. Nose has flesh and especially dry, tart skin of dark plums. Also orange juice and zest, light lacto, chiffon cake, wet sulphurous funk, light to moderate oak. Palate is aggressively sour and lactic in nature, much more than the normal Quetsche or indeed any other Tilquin Ive tried. Lemon and yogurt to the fore, some plum in the back but its rather overwhelmed by the lacto. Some fruity character is present, tart berry or pit fruit but not obviously plum. Soft fruit skins in the finish, sulphur, horse blanket. Kind of greenish wood notes on the finish, which is very dry and rather puckering with its post acidic bite. Medium bodied with very soft carb. This isnt bad but the palate is a hair too acidic for my taste. Id like to try a bottle in a year and see if its rounded out and I can get more of the plum character that should set this version of the quetsche apart.

Light opalescent bright amber-orange colour with a fine off white head, which fades. Aromas of young just about ripe prunes, funky barnyard and wet horse blanket notes as well as some woody, apple, lemony and faint nectarine hints. Light soft carbonation, a bit tangy with a light slick texture and a light-medium body. A brief tart-sweet fruityness hits the palate which develops a pleasant acidity which offers more tartness on the medium lasting finish. Refreshing and a thirst quencher.

750 mL bottle poured into a snifter. Very murky orange. Small white head. Smells very acidic. Lightly like cherry, but I guess thats just a berry aroma. Dried grass and oak. Sharply sour taste. Strong oak and sourness. Berry fruitiness. Oaky finish. Medium low carbonation. Medium body. Unclear as to what distinguishes this from Oude Quetsche. Its very sour and the fruit flavor isnt all that distinct, but its a nice lambic.
Bottle - Pours a cloudy amber. Nose is prunes, slight lemons, malty. Taste is very tart, prune, acidic, lemon, and little peppery.

Bue en bouteille de 75cl chez Will.
Couleur ambrée, peu de mousse mais grosse effervescence.
Nez sur la gueuze, la prune et acide.
En bouche première teneur sur la prune acide le questsche de nouceau la prune la mirabelle et fin de bouche sur le citron.
Deuxième bouche sur la bière réchauffée et là ça englobe complètement, la prune bonne prune le fruit et la reine Claude, cette dernière bouche est juste magnifique.

Cred check: http://i.imgur.com/dUyptRU.png 
Pours a light rose Amber. Aromas of lactic fermented fruit. Taste is very tart. Flavors of some fruit, not necessarily prunes, but fruit. Dry as a bone. Lactic, yogurt, funk. Aggressive. This is a great beer.

Bottle 750ml. Thx Adam.
Pours hazy orange with low white head. Good lacing. Aroma is of apricots, fruits, barnyard. Taste is of apricots, plums, fruits, acidity. Palate: Light-medium carbonation body. Medium carbonation. Overall: Very nice fruited lambic. Awesome. Nice plums. Fresh. Under controll.

Bottle at home- 21st July 2015. Pours cloudy pinky amber colour with a fair amount of fluff which recedes to nothing. Aroma is citric funkiness with the plummy fruit notes wafting across the top. Taste wise this is similar to the regular but the plum notes are definitely more pronounced with a lovely juiciness. Still has that definite Tilquin gueuze undercarriage. I already love the regular but this is a noticeable step forward. World class for sure.
user_location: The big bad LDN, Greater London, ENGLAND

text:
How: Bottle (750 ml) at tasting. Shared by AdamChandler, thanks! 

>>> On the same level as the "regular" Oude Quetsche. A superior fruit lambic where, even when fresh and super fruity, the lambic character is quite present. 

+  Nose is really fruity, but unlike other fresh fruit lambics (Kriek, Raspberry, Apricots), it doesnt hide the horse blanket and funky character from the lambic 
+  The acidity level is moderate and fits perfectly with the fruit 
+  The lemony character from Tilquin lambics is present as usual and reminds a bit of Cantillon lambics 
+  The moderate acidity level combined to the good balance, pinpoint carbonation and the dry finish gives a really drinkable and quenching product 
+  It definitely has a fun winey character 
○  With the two versions of the Oude Quetsche and the Mûre, Tilquin is developing a really nice portfolio of fruit lambics with fruits that arent used by other Belgian lambic producers. 

Flavors:  Really fruity (plum), horse blanket, funk, mild lemon, winey, oak, hay

Bottle shared by AdamChandler, thanks a lot Adam! Pours a hazy peach-like with a white rim that leaves good lacing. Nose is of plums. Taste is fruity and loaded with plum with some funk but it is really not the focus here. Body is medium and carbonation almost nil. Overall a nice plum lambic, Id drink that again for sure! ;)

Delicious Beer. Shared a 75CL with some friends in Canada. Acquired in Belgium during Toer de Gueuze. Enjoyed a 2-3 ounce pour at 45 Degrees F. Color was a dark plum / raisin purple. Aroma tart, ripe fruits, slightly acidic. Taste was nice. good mouthfeel, coated the tongue perfectly and left a good sweet and tart finish.

Bottle shared. Hazy gold-amber-red pour with pinkish-orange hue. Aroma is quite funky, very tart citric nose, nice fruitiness, winey, fruit peel, plum is generally quite modest. Taste is tart, very fruity, not something you could easily identify as plum but definitely fruity, grape like fruitiness, fruit skins, really nice gueuze flavor, great Tilquin taste, qui tart and citrusy. Palate is med-light bodied with good carbonation. Delicious.

pours hazy/cloudy pale golden with a small white cap, reviving and leaving nice lacing. loads of funky notes, horse blanket, ginger, parsnip, small fruits, orchard fruitiness, wheaty lemons, white pepper, light on-the-spot acidity. light carbonation, light body, pleasantly tart lemony-fruity finish. very good fruit lambic. different but as good as regular quetsch,

Special edition of Tilquin Oude Quetsche made with only Altesse plums, a blue plum variety grown around Namur, apparently. Medium thick but loosely structured and collapsing, yet retaining off-white head, colour is a warm, misty, pinkish and orangey peach. Nice, elegant and refreshing lambic funkiness in the nose with the plums already apparent at a first sniff; it seems they play a bigger part in this one than in the regular version. I get plum stones and wet wood, plum flesh (even reminiscent of unripe peaches), dry sherry, damp hay, strawberry, cava, unsweetened yoghurt, goat cheese, a hint of lime juice and of course the expected Brett horseblanket odours. Taste starts with a very tangy acidity, a stinging trace of raspberry vinegar and lemon juice, then softened by a sweetish stonefruit presence, though I would not be able to determine if these are plums or something else in a blind tasting; the plum mixes beautifully with the lambic esters, rich and elegant. There is a mellow lactic yoghurt tartness as well, a soft deep wheatiness and a touch of bready malts, before tannins begin to dominate the finish, a combined effort of wood and plum stones (and plum peel, I suppose); the lemony acidity pops up again and rounds things off with a tangy, sharp sourness in the back. The bottle is only half a year old, I reckon this gains even more nobility as it gets older, but this is already a splendid fruit lambic as it is: a soft, malse lambic character with still spritzy lemon acidity going through it, and all the time you can feel the presence of both plum flesh or juice and plum stones, completely melted in the lambic. This was the case in the regular version as well, but I strongly get the feeling that the plums in this one are more pronounced. Whatever the case, they shine beautifully in this one, this is doubtlessly another world class Belgian lambic.

Bouteille achetée chez Malts Attack à Bruxelles. Merci Antoine pour lexcellent service! La bière est de couleur orangée difficile à identifier. Elle est à la fois orangée et rosée. Une teinte qui rappelle tant la prune que la pêche ou labricot. Trouble, les énormes bulles qui firent leur apparition lors du service sestompèrent rapidement pour céder la place à une fine couche crémeuse. Très étonnant! Cest la bière dont le spectre olfactif sapparente le plus à un vin rosé sec que je connaisse. Cest à sy méprendre. La prune, ainsi ajoutée à une importante source dacidité, peur facilement passer pour du raisin avec en prime, du bois comme trame de fond. Le portrait est vineux mais sec puisquil sagit dune gueuze après tout. Acidité modérée, le tout est léger et délicat, à limage dune gueuze ayant quelques années en réserve. Cest fruité, réconfortant et combien rafraîchissant!!

Bottle shared. Pours cloudy amber with a minimal off white head. Aroma of big tart plums, barnyard funk, citrus and vinegar notes. Flavour is light heavy sour. Decent but a little too much acidity in the palate for my liking. Medium bodied with soft carbonation.

bottle courtesy of and shared with Kermis.
Very thin white head. Cloudy amber pour. Tart aftertaste.

Bottled. Pours hazy golden with a large off-white head. Aroma of barnyard, funky plums, caramel, wood notes and citrus. Slightly sweet flavor that ends up dry and tart. Light to medium bodied, oily texture and soft carbonation. An excellent Sour. 🌟🌟🌟🌟

Fully hazy orange beer with a small white head, leaving some lace. Sulphur exploses in the nose, but proves volatile. A nose of rosewater, lemon, rosehips, and red fruit. In the mouth I can trace the plums, with a lemony acidity, bread, and lactic acid.Light, bit of acidthinning, spritzy carbonation. One to keep! Will acquire a lot of depth in 6 to 12 months, Im sure.  Grand merci à Jean H.!

Sample at Tilquin Englisch Beer Festival 2015. Thanks for sharing! But actually this is the same as the very first release of Quetsche (400 bottles then).
APPEARANCE: clear orange/reddish beer, small stable white head.
NOSE: lots of prumes come out, fruity, rather sour, faint sweet.
TASTE: very fruity, long lasting taste, nicely sour, amazing!

2/V/15 - 75cl bottle @ Tilquin English Beer Festival - BB: n/a (2015-558)  Thanks to the ratebeer crew and other people for sharing todays beers!
Clear orange to amber beer, small white head, unstable, non adhesive. Aroma: funky, bit sweet, lemony, sourish, brett. MF: soft to no carbon, medium to light body. Taste: very sour, lemony, vinegar, acidic, slightly fruity, bitter, some tannins. Aftertaste: very sour, bit metallic, lemon juice, vinegar.

Slightly hazy amber colour, dissipating white head. Fruity aroma, quite sour, rather funky, lemon, tart kwetsen (sour plums). Quite sour flavour, tart lemon skins, sour fruits, prune. Sour finish, barnyard funk, fruity plum.
Prefer this over the Véritable dAlsace, which seemed to be more sweet and less fruity (could be the age, though). Was wondering when / if this one would get its own entry.
(From 75cL bottle @ Zythos 2014, Leuven and @ the gueuzerie, Tour de Geuze 2014)
Bottle in Room 21 at Hotel Damier, Kortrijk. Cloudy amber - white head. Nice sourness. Light sulphor. Wooden. Sour and fat prunes. High tart. High dryness. Citrus - high citric. nice.

kindly shared by bartlebier, thanks! Aromas of gooseberries, lacto, plums, more almost still green, unripe plum sourness in taste, could be more complex in the way of showing more and later stages of a plums life.

Fresh 37,5cl bottle (2014-2015) from source, bb01/2025. As citrus and green apple forward as any Tilquin geuze, the young prunes here just adding like a red berry/gooseberry tartness contoured by an ethereal fleshiness, distant cherry stone, barn funk. The base geuze comes through in taste, confidently dry and citric, quenching despite the 250g of prunes added per liter. Prune juice shines through in the aftertaste almost like an Obstler/Schnaps...this will hopefully surface more with age. As of now it is still a HQ sparkling geuze/lambic crossover.

Freiburg testing - courtesy of Bartlebier, many thanks Franck!
Couleur ambrée-rose, légère mousse. Super nez fruité, fruits rouges, acidulé, groseille, fruits verts, note lactique. Gout acidulé fruits verts, groseilles, note de questches avec aigreur , vieux fut et vieux boisé. Super buvable, tout ce que jaime!

Bottle 37,5cl kindly shared by Bartlebier many thanks. A cloudy amber beer with low head. Nose is amazing on fruit with lactic tart and some chocolate touch. Aroma is on green fruits, moist, mushroom, dry and tart, berries, quetsches notes itself is low on my point of view, anyway very drinkable and subtle.

bought a 75cl bottle. with other prunes compared to the quetsche version? anyway, the quetsche is one of my favorites. poured a hazzy orange colour with a white head, notes of tart, sour prunes, earth, plums, citrus, stone fruits, horseblanket, citrus, grains, sour fruit juice, bit of a lack of carbonation, very fruity, i think this will keep getting better with some age.

Pours unclear brownamber. Smell is bit sweet, fruity, mildly sour. Taste is sharp, sour , oak, fruity, complex, high carbo. Tastes a lot like a US sour beer, for some reason. complex, but I do get the feeling others enjoy this one more than I do .

Bottle at home with friends, courtesy of Bill. Thanks man! Pour is hazy pinkish-amber with a small white head and decent lacing. Big funky, cheesy, raspberry skins, plummy, lemon peel, urine, and barnyard in the aroma. Taste is white wine, tannic, woody, plums, grassy, urine, citrusy, cheesy, and funky with a medium sour finish. Medium body with high carbonation. Really delicious stuff.

Bottle @ Steve_0 during my 10k tick fest. Thanks Bill! Pours a murky orangish red appearance with an of white head. Bright plum, very funky, mild grape, lemon, cobweb nose. Smells excellent! Very juicy. Low sweetness and bitterness. Tons of dust, cobwebs, cheese. Funk. Fuck yeah. Wood bang.

Pour out of 750 mL bottle,big thanks to Bill for sharing the bottle, hazy orange almost red pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice funk, oak, cheese, hints of earth, slight plum, earth, slight tart fruit into a bit of yeast, slight bread. Taste was a mix of plum, oak, cheese, slight oak, vanilla, hints of bread, slight funky notes into a bit of yeast, finishing tart, slightly sweet. Very tasty.

Pas grand chose à redire sur cette version qui reprend les grandes lignes de ma revue de la Quetsche. A noter, une couleur tombant plus dans un pourpre présentant une certaine opacité que la Quetsche navait pas. Version dégustée à plusieurs reprises side by side avec la quetsche. Cette version procure tant un bouquet quun palais dont le fruité de prune ressort nettement mieux offrant un produit dont le profil fruité est nettement plus prononcé tout en continuant à marier le caractère de la gueuze. Question restant évidente du goût qui semble être évolutif de par les saisons, sa teneur en sucre, son transport, etc. Je pense surtout que cette version à le mérite de mettre en avant un produit régional tout comme cela est fait pas dautres pour la Schaarbeekse Kriek. Les deux Questche se valent, mais je penche plus pour cette version au niveau du ressenti de la prune.

Sampled @ Tilquin English Beer Festival. Klares rötlich/bernsteinfarbenes Bier, keine Schaumbildung. Geruch nach Steinobst, säuerlich fruchtig. Geschmack säuerlich fruchtig, reife Pflaumen, leicht holzig, spritzig.

Kolor bursztynowy, pomara?czowy.
Piana bia?a, zbudowana ze ?rednich p?cherzykowa, bardzo szybko zredukowa?a si? do kilku b?belków.
Aromat, który ju? nie pierwszy raz wyczuwam w piwach od GueuzerieTilquin a mianowicie ogórki kiszone. Do tego dochodz? owoce: truskawki, porzeczka czerwona, mo?e odrobin?, ale chyba sugestywnie ?liwki, przejrza?e, zebrane z ziemi jab?ka i winogrona daj?ce nuty winne.
Smak Oude Quetsche Tilquin jest przede wszystkim kwa?ny, dziki, bo oprócz porzeczki czerwonej s? przejrza?e truskawki, dzikie kwa?ne jab?ka,  skwaszone wino. Saturacja ?rednia w kierunku do wysokiej, goryczka wytrawna, cierpka. Ale co tu du?o pisa?, trzeba spróbowa?.

One of my favourite fruit lambics. Bottle at Tilquin English Beerfestival. Prunes, might be even more sour than the regular version, less fruity, more balanced. Awesome beer. Want to buy bottles of this one? For now, I think I like the regular one a bit better. RATING 900. Jeej.

Bottle @ Tilquin English Beef Festival 2015. Amber/red colour, no foam. Soft carbonation. Fruity with notes of lemon and stone fruit. Taste of unripe plums. Sour and easy drinkable. Very refreshing. Good Quetsche!

Thx! Sampled 750 ml. bottle @ Tilquin English Beer Festival 2015. Hazy dark amber, with no head. Lambiek is quite strong upfront in the nose, lemon, sour, with tart fruits in the back,. Flat, puckering, lemon, barnyard, light caramel, juicy fruit in the back, fruity plums Near flat. Expect this one to be a lot better in the future since I prefer Quetsche 1+ year old. Same score for now as an old bottle of the other version. I can see myself rating this one higher if I ever get to try an older bottle.
